intro: Matelea constanzana, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night and emit a fragrant scent to attract nocturnal pollinators. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a slightly hairy texture, while its stems are woody and branching. Matelea constanzana is often cultivated for its aesthetic appeal and ecological value in supporting night-flying insects.
